title: Spack setup-env.sh is really heavy
body:
### Summary

Sourcing the line `. $SPACK_ROOT/share/spack/setup-env.sh` in the `.zshrc` adds to alteast 1 second of startup time. It can become annoying, everytime you open a new tab or activate a new virtualenv for python.

#### What I expected

< 0.2 second of added startup time is reasonable.

#### What happened instead

```console
# With the setup-env.sh line
~ » time zsh -ic "source ~/.zshrc"
zsh -ic "source ~/.zshrc"  1.70s user 0.46s system 99% cpu 2.159 total

# Without the setup-env.sh line
~ » time zsh -ic "source ~/.zshrc"
zsh -ic "source ~/.zshrc"  0.43s user 0.18s system 99% cpu 0.611 total
```

See where the time is spent inside setup-env.sh
```console
# Commenting out the "build and make available environment-modules" block 
~ » time zsh -ic "source ~/.zshrc"
zsh -ic "source ~/.zshrc"  1.31s user 0.40s system 92% cpu 1.850 total

# Commenting out the "Set up modules and dotkit search paths in the user environment" block
~ » time zsh -ic "source ~/.zshrc"
zsh -ic "source ~/.zshrc"  0.50s user 0.31s system 100% cpu 0.797 total
```
### Information on your system

 1. Linux 64-bit (Arch Linux). Solid state hard disk
 2. `spack bootstrap` done.
